text:
SupraDarky, for Halloween I recommend the great Earthbound Hack Hallow's End.
You can find it at Starmen.net PK Hack forum.
Its a great hack with new characters, stories, music, monsters, etc. My only nick pick is how long it takes to Trick or Treat at the beginning of the game before the real meat of the story begins.

text:
truly an unrivaled masterpiece.

But seriously, I thought for sure Donkey Kong Country 2 and Wild Arms something was going to be in this list. I haven't played Wild Arms, but it was Best VGM #1. I'm just assuming that #1 is Chrono Trigger. That can't not be on this list.
author: GengarInfinity

text: not to take away the fact that this is number 2 and does fit with haloween...CHRONO TRIGGER NUMBAH 1
author: LeonisBrafer

text: It just does everything right when i look for in a great soundtrack; a good number of songs, a few different and unique battle themes, which i wish more modern RPGs would do, great town themes, and a great variety of songs in between for special events and other unique circumstances that all combine to become one of the greatest soundtracks of all time for the SNES.
author: Eric C.

text: We have the same view of the Earthbound OST as it is my favorite soundtrack of all time.  Honestly when I first went to listen to this soundtrack, i did not know what i was getting into.  I was thinking "is this the soundtrack that will dethrone FF VII as my favorite soundtrack of all time"? and it turns out that it did.  I absolutely loved it.  Like all the soundtracks in my Top 5, they were all experiences to listen to.
author: Eric C.

text: I only found out about SS2 earlier in the year thanks to Bioshock:Infinite, although I was a big fan of Bioshock 1 and 2 from when they came out. Played SS2 after I beat Infinite, and what an amazing game. I almost think I can say it was better than Bioshock.
author: bloodyangel1

text: Chrono Trigger or Wild Arms is what I'm betting on. Supra has loved Wild Arms from the very beginning of the list. I might be surprised though.
author: Wardog 1991

text: i sincerely doubt its FFX. it's not a game i've really heard him talk about.
author: philip0544

text: Chrono Trigger is number one. There simply is no other choice.
author: Maxadude

text: Am I the only one who feels as if this is the year of once infamously-rare games losing their rarity via digital distribution?  It's not only this game, but also System Shock 2.
author: LinkMarioSamus

text: Oh and what's that #1 game of all time I've been talking about? It's Winnie The Pooh's Home Run Derby for browsers, of course! I hope you'll be looking forward to a great VGM from that timeless masterpiece tomorrow.
author: SupraDarky

text: Earthbound has heart warming soul. Shigesato Itoi is a genius, especially when you also consider his work on the sequel. Mother 3 is quite probably in my Top 50 (which, considering all the games I played, means I find it amazing), but it lacked the sense of adventure Earthbound gave me, going from town to town, trying to fix everything around you. Just listening to the whole soundtrack on its own manages to transport you into that adventure.
author: SupraDarky

text: Now that's a perfect coincidence, my 2nd favorite game of all time has a fitting upload just for Halloween. I feel like I've already said everything I have to say about Earthbound. I can say that it has my favorite soundtrack of all time. If Earthbound's soundtrack is a 10/10, my #1 game's soundtrack is a 9.9/10. And if my #1 game is a 10/10 overall, then Earthbound is a 9.9/10. That's how close both games are in my book.
author: SupraDarky
